intro: Octomeria rotundiglossa, commonly known as the round-lip mallow, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer, and its hairy, broad leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercialized.
